intro: Spiciviscum polygynum, commonly known as the manyfemale spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and milky sap, which is typical of the genus. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Spiciviscum polygynum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
